Is the bible supposed to be a true past and future way of life or is it more like a guideline?
 

 The bible was written to preserve the history of judaism. It is a collection of stories based on events that took place in those times and within the then known world. However, as was the custom back then, those stories were greatly embellished and exagerrated to add mysticism and intrigue to them. For example, you may be familiar with the story of David and Goliath. It probably was true the David was handy with the. Sling back then, which was a simple yet effective weapon if you had the skill. It might be true that David did take out a phillistine soldier with a single shot to the face. But it is not true that Goliath was 18 feet tall, and some of the other elements of the story were also most likely added to make David more splendid than he really was. Remember, David was king, and he needed his people to believe that God had his back, so the more dramatic he could make the story, the more loyal his subjects would be. Many other stories were similiarly embellished for similar purposes.
